readily at hand.', 'Obtainable on demand - able to be acquired as soon as needed.', 'At-hand - present and within easy reach in the immediate vicinity.', 'Handy - conveniently available for use; useful.', 'Quickly available - implies that something can be obtained without a long wait.', 'Immediate - occurring or done at once; instantaneous accessibility.', 'Instantly obtainable - able to be gotten right away with no delay.', 'Convenient - easily accessible and suitable for use; fitting well within the circumstances.', 'Readily accessible - can be accessed without much effort or difficulty.', "Within reach - not far away in distance, time, etc.; attainable by someone's abilities.", 'Available at short notice - something that is prepared to be used or given quickly upon request.', 'Up-to-the-minute - very current and freshly available; no delay from the source event.', 'Promptly available - able to be provided, acted upon, or responded to with little delay.', 'Quick-fetching - implies rapid retrieval or obtainment of something needed.', 'Straightforward to obtain - uncomplicated and easy process for acquiring something.', 'Directly obtainable - able to be gotten without detours, delays, or intermediaries.', 'Instantaneously accessible - available immediately with no delay whatsoever.', 'Unfed - not having received any food; ravenous.', 'Hungry stomach - literal feeling or condition when the stomach needs food.', 'Inadequately fed - not receiving enough food, though there might be some intake.', 'Underfed - lacking sufficient nourishment due to inadequate food supply.', 'Deprived of food - being without access to necessary sustenance.', 'Nutrient-deficient - lacking essential nutrients that the body requires for normal function.', 'Fasting (when unintended) - abstaining from all or some kinds of food, which can lead to hunger if not intended.', 'Empty belly - a common expression denoting an empty stomach due to lack of food.', "Goiter (indirectly related to left hungry) - although typically associated with iodine deficiency rather than hunger, it is included as an example of malnutrition-related condition that can occur when there's a dietary imbalance.", 'Vitamin deficiency - lacking essential vitamins in the diet which may result from not having enough food or the wrong type of food.', 'Picky eater (can lead to hunger if not addressed) - someone who is selective about what they eat, possibly leading to insufficient nutrition and feeling hungry due to a lack of variety in their diet.', 'Food insecurity - the state of being without reliable access to a sufficient quantity of affordable, nutritious food.', 'Underfed child - specifically referring to children who do not receive enough nourishment for healthy development.', 'Unfulfilled appetite - an appetite that has not been satisfied due to lack of or inadequate consumption of food.', 'Empty pantry - a literal indication of no available food at home, leading potentially to hunger.', 'Lean and gaunt (due to lack of food) - physically thin in an unhealthy way, often due to insufficient nutrition or starvation.']
